programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.sub-title: Endless Summer: From Grilled Panzanella Salad to Sour Cherry Tart
programme.desc: Jamie ends summer with crispy duck in a rich plum sauce & roast potatoes. Grilled peppers star in panzanella. Garden zucchini become Mediterranean rice. Sweet finale: sour cherry frangipane with crème fraîche.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.sub-title: Stuffed Salmon Celebration and Almond Custard Tart
programme.desc: Jamie snazzes up some spuds with wild garlic pesto, creates a broad bean mezze, rustles up a beautiful spring salad and honours rhubarb in a luscious custard tart with almond brittle.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.sub-title: Summer-y Sweet Pea Risotto and Slow Roasted Pork
programme.desc: Jamie celebrates summer with roasted fennel pork & gratin, oozy pea risotto, and rainbow slaw chicken wraps. He shares edible hanging basket tips. The feast finishes with stunning mackerel on sun-dried tomato couscous with colorful beets.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.sub-title: Buddy's Strawberry Rice Pudding and Summer Tomato Chicken Bake
programme.desc: Jamie cooks a chicken sheet pan dinner with early tomatoes, potatoes and chorizo. Buddy helps pick strawberries for quick jam rice pudding. The summer feast ends with spicy shrimp skewers with homegrown chillies and a refreshing cucumber gazpacho.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.sub-title: Endless Summer: From Grilled Panzanella Salad to Sour Cherry Tart
programme.desc: Jamie ends summer with crispy duck in a rich plum sauce & roast potatoes. Grilled peppers star in panzanella. Garden zucchini become Mediterranean rice. Sweet finale: sour cherry frangipane with crème fraîche.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: On the coast in Bahía Kino, local fishermen catch giant sea scallops. Then, in the mountain town of Matape, Nere, one of Sonora's few female butchers shares her wisdom with Pati.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati learns that carne asada goes way beyond grilled meat in Sonora. It's an important weekly ritual that brings the whole family together.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati tours one of Hermosillo's oldest flour mills and gets a lesson on making coyotas, a traditional dessert, at a local bakery. In her kitchen, Pati shares her take on a classic Sonoran recipe - a carne con chile burrito.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati spends a day in the kitchen with her middle son, Sami, cooking recipes inspired by her travels in Sonora that she knows he'll love - beef and potato chimichangas, rice with lentils and caramelized onions, and an avocado and radish salad.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati travels to Sonora's coast on the Sea of Cortez, where local legend Toño Contreras gives her a tour including shellfish on the beach, his restaurant Mariscos El Rey, and his home kitchen for some crave-worthy recipes.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati makes three classic Sonoran recipes- a fish special called pescado zarandeado, a rich stew called gallina pinta, and a tasty dirty rice with clams. In Sonora, she visits vacation destination Puerto Peñasco.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati prepares a true Sonoran feast for the crew - Sonora cheese soup, chicken in pecan and ancho chile sauce.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati makes traditional tamales with corn, chiles, and cheese, and then for the main course, pork chops topped with a pickled grape salad. In Sonora, she visits a traditional hacienda, where she gets a true taste of Sonoran ranch food.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.sub-title: Crispy Pork Noodles and Cheesy Chard Cannelloni
programme.desc: Jamie celebrates rhubarb in a lip-smacking sauce, heroes spinach in a silky goat's cheese risotto and marries vibrant basil with chard in a crowd-pleasing cheesy spring cannelloni.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.sub-title: Sausage Egg & Cheese All Day Long
programme.desc: Chef Dale Talde brings out the best of brunch with sweet and savory hits such as Bacon Wrapped Dates Stuffed with Chorizo, Maple Sausage, Egg, & Cheese Fried Rice, and the tastiest BBQ Duck, Egg, & Corn Scallion Pancake Sandwiches you've ever eaten.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.sub-title: The Art of Open Fire Cooking
programme.desc: Chef Dale goes back to the roots of cooking, building a grill over an open fire to serve up a variety of dishes, including whole smoked chicken and fish, roasted cauliflower, a sweet and tangy grilled pineapple s'more dessert.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Chef Dale Talde creates a tasty menu that kids & parents alike will love! Apple pancakes with coconut brown butter syrup, grilled cheese & tomato soup, cheesy chicken parm, and a sticky s'mores dessert rounds out the full day of deliciousness.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Chef Dale Talde amps up your chicken dishes by making smoky chicken wings, a whole roasted turmeric ginger chicken with tamarind sauce, and chicken patties grilled in banana leaves with chili lime noodles. A frosty lime rickey finishes it all off!

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Mad Good Food Host Derrell Smith joins Chef Dale Talde at the grill as they cook up some stupendous sandwiches including a Salmon Pastrami Reuben, a Meatball Banh Mi, and even some Grilled Ice Cream Sandwiches.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Chef Dale Talde brings us to the bayou as he creates a NOLA-inspired menu complete with Chargrilled Oysters, Black Pepper Shrimp Po'boys, finishes it off with Bananas Foster, and washes it all down with a Fruity Grilled Hurricane.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: It's always taco night at Chef Dale's house! He turns up the heat with grilled salmon tacos with salsa verde & cauliflower escabeche, duck al pastor tacos with habanero pineapple salsa, & a smokey mushroom queso taco with truffle mole negro.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Dale's turning up the heat! Carolina Reaper wings hotter than your ex, sweet-chili NY strip steak, smoky grilled chipotle Texas toast, and ancho-gochujang pineapple skillet cake for dessert. Bring some water!

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Chef Dale is flipping burgers into art - gooey mac & cheese burgers, fancy French patties topped with melty bucheron cheese, crispy parm-truffle fries, and peanut butter fudge ice cream sandwiches. Get hungry.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Ribs are a lifestyle, and Chef Dale's living it up with smoky beef shorties in tangy red wine glaze, Miami-style pork ribs dripping in bacon-guava BBQ, spicy baked beans, and killer key lime caramel cones. Grab some napkins!

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern prepares Carne Adovada.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Nashville Hot Pheasant and Mint Basil Lemonade
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern takes a spin on Nashville-style hot fried chicken. Hot and spicy, batter coated, crispy fried pheasant is paired with a spinach salad topped with bacon vinaigrette and ice cold mint basil lemonade.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: For pig roast perfection, Chef Andrew Zimmern marinates a whole hog.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern breaks down a whole tuna and serves it three ways: grilled, raw, and poached.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern starts simmering a classic Italian Bolognese sauce, with ground bison, lots of red wine and tomatoes. Then, he adds marinated bison skirt steak tacos with borracho beans to the tailgate menu.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Goat Curry with Rice Pilaf and Carmelized Onions
programme.desc: Chef Andrew butchers a whole goat, using the leg and backstrap for a braised curry.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern makes two different dishes with red snapper: fried snapper fingers with a spicy chile-orange mayonnaise dipping sauce and a slow-roasted whole fish with an herb salad and charred miso sweet potatoes.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Grilled Turkey Legs, Creamed Greens and Lemon Orzo
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern prepares Grilled Turkey Legs, Creamed Greens and Lemon Orzo.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Quail Noodle Salad and Antelope Stew
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern creates Vietnamese cold noodle salad and grilled quail. Next, chef makes antelope stew.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Boar Ribs and Shrimp and Grits
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern makes a homemade barbecue rub, basting sauce and barbecue sauce for wild boar ribs. Next, chef shares his twist on a classic southern shrimp and grits recipe, adding a side of beautiful wild mushrooms.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.desc: Pat travels to the Emerald Coast of Destin, Florida, to join his friend Adam Evans on a spearfishing adventure, sourcing fresh fish to cook over live fire.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.desc: Pat visits Edgar Victoria, known for bringing the street foods of Mexico City to Nashville, to do some live fire cooking out in nature as they prepare one of his favorite dishes - skirt steak tlayuda.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.sub-title: The Legend of Louis Mueller's Dino Beef Ribs
programme.desc: Pat visits his close friend Wayne Mueller, third-generation pitmaster of Louis Mueller's BBQ, to learn the ins and outs of his famous dino beef ribs.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.sub-title: Hickory Smoked Virginia Ham & Mint Juleps
programme.desc: Pat Martin gets a history lesson on the origin of American barbecue from "The Professor" Tuffy Stone.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.desc: Pat Martin heads to the Cherokee National Forest for a day of fly fishing with an old friend, and to cook up their fresh catch over the campfire.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.desc: Pat Martin travels to Gainesboro, Tennessee to visit a free-range hog farm, learn about their operations, and grill up a less desired, but no less delicious, cut of hog - pork steaks.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.sub-title: South Carolina Peach-Glazed Ribs with Rice Middlins
programme.desc: When Pat's friends and fellow barbecue chefs, Bryan Furman and Dr. Howard Conyers, come to town, the guys dig deep into the tricks and traditions of one of Bryan's specialties: pork ribs.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.sub-title: Red Curry Braised Pork with Mustard Greens
programme.desc: Pat Martin is in the frozen tundra of Minnesota to visit his new friend, Chef Yia Vang. They brave the cold and break nearly-frozen ground to barbecue a pig's head in the earth.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.desc: Pat Martin links up with his pal, Bill Darsinos, to enjoy a tradition from the heart of Bill's Greek culture when they cook a whole lamb on a spit roast.
